    <dl>
           <dt>a 1</dt>
           <dd><em>a</em> the first letter of the alphabet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the first short vowel inherent in consonants. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p1-1"></a>[Page 1, Column 1]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ak&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ra</em> m. the letter or sound <em>a</em></dd>

           <dt>a 2</dt>
           <dd><em>a</em> (<em>prag&#x1e5b;hya</em>, q.v.), a vocative particle [<em>a ananta</em>, O Vish&#x1e47;u] T </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; interjection of pity, Ah!</dd>

           <dt>a 3</dt>
           <dd><em>a</em> (before a vowel <em>an</em>, exc. <em>a-&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;in</em>), a prefix corresponding to Gk. ?, ?, Lat. <em>in</em>, Goth. [1, 1] and Germ. <em>un</em>, Eng. <em>in</em> or <em>un</em>, and having a negative or privative or contrary sense (<em>an-eka</em> not one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>an-anta</em> endless </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>a-sat</em> not good </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>a-pa&#x015b;yat</em> not seeing) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely prefixed to Inf. (<em>a-svaptum</em> not to sleep T&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;yaBr.) and even to forms of the finite verb (<em>a-sp&#x1e5b;hayanti</em> they do not desire BhP. &#x015a;i&#x015b;.) and to pronouns (<em>a-sa&#x1e25;</em> not he &#x015a;i&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>a-tad</em> not that BhP.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; occasionally denoting comparison (<em>a-br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;a</em> like a Brahman T.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes disparagement (<em>a-yaj&#x00f1;a</em> a miserable sacrifice) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes diminutiveness (cf. <em>&#x00e1;-kar&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>an-udar&#x0101;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely an expletive (cf. <em>a-kupya</em>, <em>a-p&#x016b;pa</em>). According to P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-2, 161, the accent may be optionally either on the first or last syllable in certain compounds formed with <em>a</em> (as <em>&#x00e1;-t&#x012b;k&#x1e63;&#x1e47;a</em> or <em>a-t&#x012b;k&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em>, <em>&#x00e1;-&#x015b;uci</em> or <em>a-&#x015b;uc&#x00ed;</em>, <em>&#x00e1;n-anna</em> or <em>an-ann&#x00e1;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the same applies to stems ending in <em>t&#x1e5b;</em> accentuated on the first syllable before <em>a</em> is prefixed </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. also <em>&#x00e1;-t&#x016b;rta</em> and <em>a-t&#x016b;&#x0341;rta</em>, <em>&#x00e1;-bhinna</em> and <em>a-bhinn&#x00e1;</em>, &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>a 4</dt>
           <dd><em>a</em> the base of some pronouns and pronom. forms, in <em>asya</em>, <em>atra</em>, &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>a 5</dt>
           <dd><em>a</em> the augment prefixed to the &#x221a;in the formation of the imperfect, aorist, and conditional tenses (in the Veda often wanting, as in Homer, the fact being that originally the augment was only prefixed in principal sentences where it was accentuated, whilst it was dropped in subordinate sentences where the root-vowel took the accent)</dd>

           <dt>a 6</dt>
           <dd><em>a</em> m. N. of Vishnu L. (especially as the first of the three sounds in the sacred syllable <em>om</em>)</dd>

           <dt>a&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;in </dt>
           <dd><em>a-&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;in</em> mfn. free from debt L</dd>

           <dt>a&#x1e43;&#x015b; </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e43;&#x015b;</em> cl. 10. P. <em>a&#x1e43;&#x015b;ayati</em>, to divide, distribute L. ; also occasionally &#x0100;. <em>a&#x1e43;&#x015b;ayate</em> L. ; also <em>a&#x1e43;&#x015b;&#x0101;payati</em> L</dd>

           <dt>a&#x1e43;&#x015b;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;&#x1e43;&#x015b;a</em> m. (probably fr. &#x221a;1. <em>a&#x015b;</em>, perf. <em>&#x0101;n-&#x00e1;&#x1e43;&#x015b;a</em>, and not from the above &#x221a;<em>a&#x1e43;&#x015b;</em> fictitiously formed to serve as root), a share, portion, part, party </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; partition, inheritance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a share of booty </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; earnest money </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; stake (in betting) RV. v, 86, 5 T&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;yaBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a lot (cf. 2. <em>pr&#x00e2;s</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the denominator of a fraction </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a degree of latitude or longitude </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a day L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of an &#x0100;ditya</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; a&#x1e43;&#x015b;akara&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kara&#x1e47;a</em> n. act of dividing</dd>

[with the Vedic weak stem <em>&#x0101;k&#x1e63;</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#perf">perf.</a> <em>&#x0101;&#x015b;-u&#x1e25;</em> 3. pl. &amp;c. fr. &#x221a;1. <em>a&#x015b;</em>] <em>&#x0101;k&#x1e63;&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em>), </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to reach RV. x, 22, 11 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to pass through, penetrate, pervade, embrace L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to accumulate (to from the cube?) L.: Caus. <em>ak&#x1e63;ayati</em>, <em>&#x0101;cik&#x1e63;at</em>, to cause to pervade L.: Desid. <em>acik&#x1e63;i</em>, <em>&#x1e63;ati</em> or <em>acik&#x1e63;ati</em> L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ak&#x1e63;a 1</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; the beam of a balance or string which holds the pivot of the beam </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a snake L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; terrestrial latitude (cf. <em>-kar&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>-bh&#x0101;</em>, <em>-bh&#x0101;ga</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the collar-bone &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the temporal bone Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1; </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Old Germ. <em>ahsa</em> ; <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p3-1"></a>[Page 3, Column 1]</font>

           <dd>&#x2022; a vowel </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a word </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Brahma </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; final beatitude religious austerity, sacrifice L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; Achyranthes Aspera</dd>

(Since an anikini consists of 27 v&#x0101;hinis, and 27 is the cube of 3, <em>ak&#x1e63;auhi&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em> may be a compound of 2. <em>ak&#x1e63;a</em> and <em>v&#x0101;hini</em> </dd>

           <dt>agasti </dt>
           <dd><em>ag&#x00e1;sti</em> m. (according to U&#x1e47;. iv, 179 fr. 2. <em>a-ga</em>, a mountain, and <em>asti</em>, thrower, &#x221a;2. <em>as</em>). N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi (author of several Vedic hymns </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; said to have been the son of both Mitra and Varu&#x1e47;a by Urva&#x015b;&#x012b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to have been born in a water-jar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to have been of short stature </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to have swallowed the ocean, and compelled the Vindhya mountains to prostrate themselves before him </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to have conquered and civilized the South </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to have written on medicine, &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the star Canopus (of which Agastya is the regent, said to be the 'cleanser of water', because of turbid waters becoming clean at its rising Ragh. xiii, 36) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; destitute of good qualities </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a limb, member </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a subordinate division or department, especially of a science, as the six Ved&#x0101;&#x1e45;gas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence the number six </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the chief sacred texts of the Jainas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a limb or subdivision of Mantra or counsel (said to be five, viz. 1. <em>karma&#x1e47;&#x0101;m &#x0101;rambh&#x00f4;p&#x0101;ya&#x1e25;</em>, means of commencing operations </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. <em>puru&#x1e63;a-dravya-sampad</em>, providing men and materials </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; 5. <em>k&#x0101;rya-siddhi</em>, successful accomplishment ; whence <em>mantra</em> is said to be <em>pa&#x00f1;c&#x00e2;&#x1e45;ga</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any subdivision, a supplement </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Gr.) the base of a word, but in the strong cases only P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 13 seqq </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; anything inferior or secondary, anything immaterial or unessential,         <br>          <em>a&#x1e45;ga-t&#x0101;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhetoric) an illustration </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in the drama) the whole of the subordinate characters </dd>

           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;rita</em> mfn. charred, roasted, (g. <em>t&#x0101;rak&#x00e2;di</em>, q.v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'burnt', a kind of food not to be accepted by Jaina ascetics Jain </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a portable fire-place L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a bud L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a creeper L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a river L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. the early blossom of the Ki&#x1e43;&#x015b;uka</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;rin </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;rin</em> mfn. heated by the sun, though no longer exposed to its rays VarB&#x1e5b;S. [generally f. (<em>i&#x1e47;&#x012b;</em>), scil. <em>di&#x015b;</em>, the region just left by the sun] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a creeper</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;r&#x012b;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;r&#x012b;ya</em> mfn. fit for making charcoal P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-1, 12 Sch</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;ry&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;g&#x0101;ry&#x0101;</em> f. a heap of charcoal, (g. <em>p&#x0101;&#x015b;&#x00e2;di</em>, q.v.)</dd>

           <dt>a&#x1e45;gik&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;gik&#x0101;</em> <em>a&#x1e45;gaka</em></dd>

           <dt>a&#x1e45;gir </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;gir</em> <em>&#x012b;r</em> m. (&#x221a;<em>a&#x1e45;g</em> U&#x1e47;.), N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi, who received the Brahmavidy&#x0101; from Atharvan, and imparted it te Satyav&#x0101;ha, the teacher of A&#x1e45;giras Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;gira </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;&#x1e45;gira</em> m. = <em>&#x00e1;&#x1e45;giras</em> RV. i, 83, 4 and iv, 51, 4 MBh. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. (cf. Gk. ? and ?.) [8, 1] <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p8-2"></a>[Page 8, Column 2]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;giras </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;&#x1e45;giras</em>, <em>&#x0101;s</em> m. N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi, author of the hymns of RV. ix, of a code of laws, and of a treatise on astronomy (he is said by some to have been born from Brahm&#x0101;'s mouth, and to have been the husband of Sm&#x1e5b;iti, of &#x015a;raddh&#x0101;, of two daughters of Maitreya, of several daughters of Daksha, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is considered as one of the seven &#x1e5a;ishis of the first Manvantara, as a Praj&#x0101;pati, as a teacher of the Brahmavidy&#x0101;, which he had learnt from Satyav&#x0101;ha, a descendant of Bharadv&#x0101;ja, &amp;c. Among his sons, the chief is Agni, others are Sa&#x1e43;varta, Utathya, and B&#x1e5b;ihaspati </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; among his daughters are mentioned Siniv&#x0101;l&#x012b;, Kuh&#x016b;, R&#x0101;k&#x0101;, Anumati, and Ak&#x016b;p&#x0101;r&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but the &#x1e5a;icas or Vedic hymns, the manes of Havishmat, and mankind itself are styled his offspring. In astronomy he is the planet Jupiter, and a star in Ursa Major) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Agni MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>asas</em>), m. pl. descendants of A&#x1e45;giras or of Agni (mostly personifications of luminous objects) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hymns of the Atharva-veda TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; priests who by using the magical formulas of those hymns protect the sacrifice against the effects of inauspicious accidents</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; a&#x1e45;girastama </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tama</em> (<em>&#x00e1;&#x1e45;giras-</em>), mfn. having the luminous quality of the A&#x1e45;girasas in the highest degree, said of Agni and of Ushas RV</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; a&#x1e45;girasvat </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vat</em> ind. like A&#x1e45;giras RV. VS.? (<em>&#x00e1;&#x1e45;giras-vat</em>), mfn. connected with or accompanied by the A&#x1e45;girasas RV. VS</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;girasa </dt>
           <dd><em>a&#x1e45;girasa</em> m. an enemy of Vish&#x1e47;u in his incarnation of Para&#x015b;ur&#x0101;ma</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; a&#x1e45;giras&#x0101;mayana </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; aja 1</dt>
           <dd><em>aj&#x00e1;</em> m. a drove, troop (of Maruts) AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a driver, mover, instigator, leader </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Indra, of Rudra, of one of the Maruts [<em>aj&#x00e1; &#x00e9;ka-p&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> RV., and <em>aj&#x00e1; &#x00e9;ka-p&#x0101;da</em> AV.], of Agni, of the sun, of Brahm&#x0101;, of Vish&#x1e47;u, of &#x015a;iva, of K&#x0101;ma (cf. 2. <em>a-ja</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the leader of a flock </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a he-goat, ram [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> [9, 2] ?,? </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Lith. ?] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sign Aries </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the vehicle of Agni </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; beam of the sun (P&#x016b;shan) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; hence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; henceforth, from that time </dd>

           <dt>atasth&#x0101;na </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;-tasth&#x0101;na</em> (&#x221a;<em>sth&#x0101;</em>), mfn. not suiting or fitting &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>at&#x0101;pasa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;-t&#x0101;pasa</em> mfn. not an ascetic &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>ati </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;ti</em> ind. [probably neut. of an obsolete adj. <em>atin</em>, passing, going, beyond ; &#x221a;<em>at</em>, and <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Old">Old.</a> Germ. <em>anti</em>, <em>unti</em>, <em>inti</em>, <em>unde</em>, <em>indi</em>, &amp;c. ; Eng. <em>and</em> ; Germ. <em>und</em> ; Gk. ?, ?, Lat. <em>ante</em> ; Lith. <em>ant</em> ; <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p12-2"></a>[Page 12, Column 2]</font>
 Arm. <em>ti</em> ; Zd. <em>aiti</em>]. As a prefix to verbs and their derivatives, expresses beyond, over, and, if not standing by itself, leaves the accent on the verb or its derivative </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>as</em>, <em>ati-kram</em> (&#x221a;<em>kram</em>), to overstep, Ved. Inf. <em>ati-kr&#x00e1;me</em>, (fit) to be walked on, to be passed RV. i, 105, 16, <em>ati-kr&#x00e1;ma&#x1e47;a</em>, n. s.v. When prefixed to nouns, not derived from verbs, it expresses beyond, surpassing, <em>as</em>, <em>ati-ka&#x015b;a</em>, past the whip, <em>ati-m&#x0101;nu&#x1e63;a</em>, superhuman, &amp;c., s.v. As a separable adverb or preposition (with acc.), Ved. beyond </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with gen.)over, at the top of RV. AV</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ati </dt>
           <dd><em>ati</em> is often prefixed to nouns and adjectives, and rarely to verbs, in the sense excessive, extraordinary, intense </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; excessively, too </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exceedingly, very </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in such compounds the accent is generally on <em>&#x00e1;ti</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; atika&#x1e6d;hora </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ka&#x1e6d;hora</em> mfn. very hard, too hard</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; atikatha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;katha</em> mfn. exaggerated </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. an exaggerated tale </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also s.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; atikar&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a </dt>

           <dt>atha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;tha</em> (or Ved. <em>&#x00e1;th&#x0101;</em>), ind. (probably fr. pronom. base <em>a</em>), an auspicious and inceptive particle (not easily expressed in English), now </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; then </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; moreover </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rather </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; certainly </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; else </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; what? how else? &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; athakim </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kim</em> ind. how else? what else? certainly, assuredly, sure enough</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; athakimu </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kimu</em> ind. how much more </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; so much the more</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; athaca </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ca</em> ind. moreover, and likewise</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; athatu </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tu</em> ind. but, on the contrary</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; athav&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;v&#x0101;</em> ind. or or, rather </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (when repeated) either or </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or rather </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or perhaps </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; what? is it not so? &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; athav&#x0101;pi </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;v&#x00e2;pi</em> ind. or, rather</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ath&#x0101;tas </dt>
           <dd><em>ath&#x00e2;tas</em> ind. now</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ath&#x0101;nantaram </dt>
           <dd><em>ath&#x00e2;nantaram</em> ind. now</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ath&#x0101;pi </dt>
           <dd><em>ath&#x00e2;pi</em> ind. so much the more </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; moreover </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; therefore </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thus</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; atho </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;th&#x00f4;</em> ind. ( = <em>atha</em> above), now </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; likewise </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; next </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; therefore</dd>

           <dt>atharvan </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;tharvan</em> <em>&#x0101;</em> m. (said to be fr. an obsolete word <em>athar</em>, fire), a priest who has to do with fire and Soma </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the priest who is said to have been the first to institute the worship of fire and offer Soma and prayers (he is represented as a Praj&#x0101;pati, as Brahm&#x0101;'s eldest son, as the first learner and earliest teacher of the Brahma-vidy&#x0101;, as the author of the Atharva-veda, as identical with A&#x1e45;giras, as the father of Agni, &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of &#x015a;iva, Vasish&#x1e6d;ha [Kir. x, 10], Soma, Pr&#x0101;&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>, <em>a</em>), m. n. the fourth or Atharva-veda (said to have been composed by Atharvan, and consisting chiefly of formulas and spells intended to counteract diseases and calamities) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e1;tharv&#x0101;&#x1e47;as</em>). pl. m. descendants of Atharvan, often coupled with those of A&#x1e45;giras and Bh&#x1e5b;igu </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hymns of the Atharva-veda</dd>

           <dt>ad 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ad</em> cl.2. P. <em>&#x00e1;tts</em>, <em>&#x0101;da</em>, <em>atsyati</em>, <em>attum</em>, to eat, consume, devour, Ved.            <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>edo</em> ; Goth. &#x221a;<em>&#x0101;&#x1e6d;</em> pres. <em>ita</em> ; Germ. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p17-3"></a>[Page 17, Column 3]</font>

           <dt>advaita </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;-dvaita</em> mfn. destitute of duality, having no duplicate &#x015a;Br. xiv, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; peerless </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sole, unique </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; epithet of Vish&#x1e47;u </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. non-duality </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; identity of Brahm&#x0101; or of the Param&#x0101;tman or supreme soul with the Jiv&#x0101;tman or human soul </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; identity of spirit and matter </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the ultimate truth </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; title of an Upanishad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ena</em>), ind. solely</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x00e1;-dharma</em> m. unrighteousness, injustice, irreligion, wickedness </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; demerit, guilt </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Praj&#x0101;pati (son of Brahm&#x0101;, husband of Hi&#x1e43;s&#x0101; or M&#x1e5b;ish&#x0101;) </dd>

           <dt>adhi 1</dt>
           <dd><em>adhi</em> m. (better <em>&#x0101;dhi</em>, q.v.), anxiety, (<em>is</em>), f. a woman in her courses (= <em>avi</em>, q.v.) L</dd>

           <dt>adhi 2</dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;dhi</em> ind., as a prefix to verbs and nouns, expresses above, over and above, besides. As a separable adverb or preposition </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with abl.) Ved. over </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; from above, from </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; from the presence of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; after AitUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; instead of RV. i, 140, 11, (with loc.) Ved. over </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; on </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in comparision with </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with acc.) over, upon, concerning</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; adhyadhi </dt>
           <dd><em>adhy-adhi</em> ind. on high, just above K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; adhika </dt>
           <dd><em>adhika</em> mfn. additional, subsequent, later </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; surpassing (in number or quantity or quality), superior, more numerous </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; abundant </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; excellent </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; supernumerary, redundant </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; secondary, inferior </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; intercalated </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. surplus, abundance, redundancy, hyperbole, ind. exceedingly, too much </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; more</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; adhikak&#x1e63;ayak&#x0101;rin </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;ayak&#x0101;rin</em> mfn. causing excessive waste</dd>

           <dt>adhik&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>adhi-k&#x1e5b;</em> &#x221a;1. to place at the head, appoint </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to aim at, regard </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to refer or allude to </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to superintend, be at the head of (loc.) MBh. iv, 241 : &#x0100;. <em>-kurute</em>, to be or become entitled to (acc.) MBh. iii, 1345 <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p20-3"></a>[Page 20, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be or become superior to, overcome P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 33</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; adhikara&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>adhi-kara&#x1e47;a</em> n. the act of placing at the head or of subordinating government, supremacy, magistracy, court of justice </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a receptacle, support </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a claim </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a topic, subject </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in philosophy) a substratum </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a subject (e.g. <em>&#x0101;tman</em> is the <em>adhi-kara&#x1e47;a</em> of knowledge) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a category </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a relation </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Gr.) government </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; location, the sense of the locative case </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; relationship of words in a sentence (which agree together, either as adjective and substantive, or as subject and predicate, or as two substantives in apposition) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhetoric) a topic </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a paragraph or minor section </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (mfn.), having to superintend</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; adhvaryu </dt>
           <dd><em>adhvary&#x00fa;</em> m. one who institutes an Adhvara any officiating priest </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a priest of a particular class (as distinguished from the <em>hot&#x1e5b;</em>, the <em>udg&#x0101;t&#x1e5b;</em>, and the <em>brahman</em> classes. The Adhvaryu priests 'had to measure the ground, to build the altar, to prepare the sacrificial vessels, to fetch wood and water, to light the fire, to bring the animal and immolate it' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; whilst engaged in these duties, they had to repeat the hymns of the Yajur-veda, hence that Veda itself is also called Adhvaryu) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>adhvaryavas</em>), pl. the adherents of the Yajur-veda, (<em>us</em>), f. the wife of an Adhvaryu priest P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-1, 66 Sch</dd>

           <dt>anantara </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. contiguousness </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Brahma or the supreme soul (as being of one entire essence), (<em>am</em>), ind. immediately after </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; after </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; afterwards</dd>

           <dt>anu 3</dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;nu</em> ind. (as a prefix to verbs and nouns, expresses) after, along, alongside, lengthwise, near to, under, subordinate to, with. (When prefixed to nouns, especially in adverbial compounds), according to, severally, each by each, orderly, methodically, one after another, repeatedly. (As a separable preposition, with accusative) after, along, over, near to, through, to, towards, at, according to, in order, agreeably to, in regard to, inferior to P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 86. As a separable adverb) after, afterwards, thereupon, again, further, then, next</dd>

           <dd><em>anu-&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;u</em> (&#x221a;<em>stu</em>), to praise RV</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;uti </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;nu-&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;uti</em> f. praise RV</dd>

           <dt>anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ubh 1</dt>
           <dd><em>anu-&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ubh</em> (&#x221a;<em>stubh</em>), to praise after, to follow in praising Nir</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ubh 2</dt>
           <dd><em>anu-&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00fa;bh</em> <em>p</em> (nom. <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00fa;k</em> TS.), f. following in praise or invocation </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of metre consisting of four P&#x0101;das or quarter-verses of eight syllables each (according to the DaivBr., quoted in Nir. vii, 12, so called because it <em>anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;obhati</em> i.e. follows with its praise the G&#x0101;yatr&#x012b;, which consists of three P&#x0101;das) RV. x, 130, 4, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in later metrical systems, the Anush&#x1e6d;ubh constitutes a whole class of metres, consisting of four times eight syllables) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence the number eight </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; speech, Sarasvat&#x012b; L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (mfn.), praising RV. x, 124, 9</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;upkarm&#x012b;&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00fa;p-karm&#x012b;&#x0341;&#x1e47;a</em> mfn. being performed with an <em>anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ubh</em> verse &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;upchandas </dt>
           <dd><em>anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00fa;p-chandas</em> mfn. having <em>anu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ubh</em> for metre MaitrS</dd>

           <dt>anta </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;nta</em> m. end, limit, boundary, term </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; end of a texture </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; end, conclusion </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; end of life, death, destruction (in these latter senses some times neut.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a final syllable, termination </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; last word of a compound </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; border, outskirt (e.g. <em>gr&#x0101;m&#x00e2;nte</em>, in the outskirts of the village) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; nearness, proximity, presence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inner part, inside </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; condition, nature </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e</em>), loc. c. in the end, at last </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the inside </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. as far as (ifc., e.g. <em>udak&#x00e2;ntam</em>, as far as the water) ; (mfn.), near, handsome, agreeable L. [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Goth">Goth.</a> <em>andeis</em>, Theme <em>andja</em> ; Germ. <em>Ende</em> ; Eng. <em>end</em>: with <em>anta</em> are also compared the Gk. ?, ? ; Lat. <em>ante</em> ; the Goth. <em>anda</em> in [42, 3] <em>anda-vaurd</em>, &amp;c. ; and the Germ. <em>ent</em> e.g. in <em>entsagen</em>]</dd>

           <dt>antar </dt>
           <dd><em>ant&#x00e1;r</em> ind. within, between, amongst, in the middle or interior. (As a prep. with loc.) in the middle, in, between, into ; (with acc.) between ; (with gen.) in, in the middle. (ifc.) in, into, in the middle of, between, out of the midst of [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zend">Zend.</a> ? ; Lat. <em>inter</em> ; Goth. <em>undar</em>]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; antar </dt>
           <dd><em>antar</em> is sometimes compounded with a following word like an adjective, meaning interior, internal, intermediate</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; antaragni </dt>

           <dt>antara </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;ntara</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>) n. being in the interior, interior </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; near, proximate, related, intimate </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; lying adjacent to </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; distant </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; different from </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exterior </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. the interior </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a hole, opening </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the interior part of a thing, the contents </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; soul, heart, supreme soul </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; interval, intermediate space or time </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; period </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; term </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; opportunity, occasion </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; place </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; distance, absence </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; difference, remainder </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; property, peculiarity </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; weakness, weak side </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; representation </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; surety, guaranty </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; respect, regard </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.), different, other, another, e.g. <em>de&#x015b;&#x00e2;ntaram</em>, another country </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), or <em>-t&#x00e1;s</em> ind. in the interior, within [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Goth">Goth.</a> <em>anthar</em>, Theme <em>anthara</em> ; Lith. <em>antra-s</em>, 'the second' ; Lat. <em>alter</em>]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; anyonya </dt>
           <dd><em>anyonya</em> or (said to be fr. <em>anyas</em> nom. sing. m. and <em>anya</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; anyonya </dt>
           <dd><em>anyo-'nya</em> (said to be fr. <em>anyas</em> nom. sing. m. and <em>anya</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>paraspara</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in most cases the first <em>anya</em> may be regarded as the subject of the sentence, while the latter assumes the acc., inst., gen., or loc. cases as required by the verb </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but there are many instances in which the first <em>anya</em>, originally a nominative, is equivalent to an oblique case) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one another, mutual </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; or may express deterioration, inferiority, &amp;c. (cf. <em>apa-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha</em>).            <dt>apara 2</dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;para</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (fr. <em>&#x00e1;pa</em>), posterior, later, latter (opposed to <em>p&#x016b;&#x0341;rva</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; the hind quarter of an elephant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the womb L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;&#x0341;</em>), f. (used in the pl.) or (<em>&#x00e1;m</em>) [RV. vi, 33, 5], n. the future RV. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e1;param</em> <em>&#x0101;V.</em> or <em>apar&#x00e1;m</em> <em>&#x1e5b;V.</em>), ind. in future, for the future </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>aparam</em>), ind. again, moreover P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b;. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the west of (abl.) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e&#x1e47;a</em>), ind. (with acc.) behind, west, to the west of K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.            <dd><em>ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;h&#x00e1;</em> m. (fr. &#x221a;<em>sth&#x0101;</em> with <em>apa</em> APr&#x0101;t </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;havat </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vat</em> (<em>ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;h&#x00e1;-</em>), mfn. having barbs RV. x, 85, 34</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hi </dt>
           <dd><em>ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hi</em> = <em>ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em> in comp. with</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hiha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;h&#x00e1;</em> or mfn. killing with the claws &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ap&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hihan </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;h&#x00e1;n</em> mfn. killing with the claws &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;s 1</dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;p&#x00e2;s</em> (&#x221a;1. <em>as</em>), 'to be absent from, not to participate in', <em>apa-par&#x00ea;</em></dd>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;s 2</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; to take no notice of, disregard</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; killing, slaughter L</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; driven away </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; carried off or away, abandoned, discarded </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; contemned</dd>

           <dd><em>ap&#x00e2;sya</em> ind. p. having thrown away or discarded </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; having left having disregarded </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; having excepted. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p55-1"></a>[Page 55, Column 1]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ap&#x0101;syat </dt>
           <dd><em>ap&#x00e2;syat</em> mfn. discarding, throwing off, &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;sa&#x1e45;ga </dt>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;su </dt>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;s&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>ap&#x00e2;-&#x221a;s&#x1e5b;</em> (<em>apa-&#x0101;-</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or <em>ap&#x0101;</em> for <em>apa</em>, the <em>&#x0101;</em> standing in the antepenultimate of a &#x015b;loka), to turn off from, avoid (with abl.) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. ii, 262</dd>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;sth&#x0101; </dt>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;han </dt>
           <dd><em>ap&#x00e2;-&#x221a;han</em> to throw off or back &#x1e62;a&#x1e0d;vBr</dd>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;h&#x0101;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>ap&#x0101;-h&#x0101;ya</em> ind. p. (fr. &#x221a;3. <em>h&#x0101;</em> with <em>apa</em>, the <em>a</em> being metrically lengthened), quitting MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; disregarding ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; excepting, except ib</dd>

           <dt>ap&#x0101;h&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>ap&#x00e2;-&#x221a;h&#x1e5b;</em> &#x0100;. to take off &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>api </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;pi</em> or sometimes <em>pi</em> ( <em>pi-d&#x1e5b;bh</em>, <em>pi-dh&#x0101;</em>, <em>pi-nah</em>), expresses placing near or over, uniting to, annexing, reaching to, proximity, &amp;c. [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ? Zd. <em>api</em> ; Germ. and Eng. prefix <em>be</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in later [55, 1] Sansk&#x1e5b;it its place seems frequently supplied by <em>abhi</em>. (As a separable adv.) and, also, moreover, besides, assuredly, surely </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>api api</em>, or <em>api-ca</em>, as well as </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na v&#x00e2;pi</em> or <em>na apiv&#x0101;</em> or <em>na nac&#x00e2;pi</em>, neither, nor, <em>c&#x00e2;pi</em>, (and at the beginning of a sentence) <em>api-ca</em>, moreover</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; api </dt>
           <dd><em>api</em> is often used to express emphasis, in the sense of even, also, very </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. <em>anyad api</em>, also another, something more </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ady&#x00e2;pi</em>, this very day, even now </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>tath&#x00e2;pi</em>, even thus, notwithstanding </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yady api</em>, even if, although </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yadyapi tath&#x00e2;pi</em>, although, nevertheless </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na kad&#x0101;cid api</em>, never at any time: sometimes in the sense of but, only, at least, e.g. <em>muh&#x016b;rtam api</em>, only a moment</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; api </dt>
           <dd><em>api</em> may be affixed to an interrogative to make it indefinite, e.g. <em>ko'pi</em>, any one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kutr&#x00e2;pi</em>, anywhere</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; api </dt>
           <dd><em>api</em> imparts to numerals the notion of totality, e.g. <em>catur&#x1e47;am api var&#x1e47;&#x0101;n&#x0101;m</em>, of all the four castes</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; api </dt>
           <dd><em>api</em> may be interrogative at the beginning of a sentence</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; api </dt>
           <dd><em>api</em> may strengthen the original force of the Potential, or may soften the Imperative, like the English 'be pleased to' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes it is a mere expletive</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; apitu </dt>
           <dd><em>api-tu</em> but, but yet</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; apitva </dt>
           <dd><em>api-tv&#x00e1;</em> n. having part, share AV. &#x015a;Br. (cf. <em>apa-pitv&#x00e1;</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; apitvin </dt>
           <dd><em>api-tv&#x00ed;n</em> mfn. having part, sharing &#x015a;Br</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; apin&#x0101;ma </dt>
           <dd><em>api-n&#x0101;ma</em> (in the beginning of a phrase), perhaps, in all probability, I wish that M&#x1e5b;icch. &#x015a;&#x0101;k. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; apivat </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;pi-vat</em> mf(<em>vat&#x012b;</em>)n. <em>api-&#x221a;vat</em></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. the remote or unforeseen consequence of an act (as heaven of religious rites) Ny&#x0101;yam </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a consequence not immediately preceded by its cause </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e9;&#x1e47;a</em>), ind. never before AV. x, 8, 33</dd>

           <dt>apsaras </dt>
           <dd><em>ap-sar&#x00e1;s</em> <em>&#x0101;s</em> [RV. AV.&amp;c.], or <em>ap-sar&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> [AV. &amp;c.], f. (fr. 2. <em>&#x00e1;p</em> + &#x221a;<em>s&#x1e5b;</em>), 'going in the waters or between the waters of the clouds', a class of female divinities (sometimes called 'nymphs' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they inhabit the sky, but often visit the earth </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they are the wives of the Gandharvas (q.v.) and have the faculty of changing their shapes at will </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they are fond of the water </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of their number, Rambh&#x0101;, is said to have been produced at the churning of the ocean)</dd>

           <dt>abhi </dt>
           <dd><em>abh&#x00ed;</em> ind. (a prefix to verbs and nouns, expressing) to, towards, into, over, upon. (As a prefix to verbs of motion) it expresses the notion or going towards, approaching, &amp;c. (As a prefix to nouns not derived from verbs) it expresses superiority, intensity, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. <em>abhi-t&#x0101;mra</em>, <em>abhi-nava</em>, q.v. (As a separate adverb or preposition) it expresses (with acc.) to, towards, in the direction of, against </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; into &#x015a;Br. and K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for, for the sake of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; on account of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; on, upon, with regard to, by, before, in front of </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; over. It may even express one after the other, severally P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 91, e.g. <em>v&#x1e5b;k&#x1e63;a&#x1e43; v&#x1e5b;k&#x1e63;am abhi</em>, tree after tree [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ? ; Lat. <em>ob</em> ; Zend [61, 1] <em>aibi</em>, <em>aiwi</em> ; Goth. <em>bi</em> ; Old High Germ. <em>b&#x012b;</em>]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; abhika </dt>
           <dd><em>abhika</em> mfn. (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-2, 74) lustful, libidinous Ragh. xix, 4 (cf. 1. <em>abh&#x012b;ka</em> and <em>anuka</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a lover Naish</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to remember (either with the fut, p. or with <em>yad</em> and impf.) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-2, 112 seqq. Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; abhij&#x00f1;a </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; understanding, conversant with (gen. or ifc.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. remembrance, recollection P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-2, 112 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; supernatural science or faculty of a Buddha (of which five are enumerated, viz. 1. taking any form at will </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. hearing to any distance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. seeing to any distance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 4. penetrating men's thoughts </dd>

           <dt>abhra </dt>
           <dd><em>abhr&#x00e1;</em> (sometimes spelt <em>abbhra</em>, according to the derivation <em>ab-bhra</em>, 'water-bearer' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Comm">Comm.</a> on ChUp. ii, 15, 1), n. (rarely m. AV. ix, 6, 47 and TS.) cloud, thunder-cloud, rainy weather RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sky, atmosphere &#x015a;i&#x015b;. ix, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in arithmetic) a cypher </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x1e47;B&#x1e0d;.</em> dust AV. xi, 3, 6 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in med.) talc, mica </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gold L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; camphor L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the ratan (Calamus Rotang) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Cyperus Rotundus L. ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ? &amp; Lat. [79, 3] <em>imber</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; abhra&#x1e43;liha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x1e43;-liha</em> (<em>abhra&#x1e43;-l&#x25cb;</em>), mfn. [P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-2, 32] 'cloud-licking', what touches the clouds, high, lofty Ragh. xiv, 29, &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>amb&#x016b;krita </dt>
           <dd><em>amb&#x016b;-krita</em> mfn. (<em>amb&#x016b;</em> used onomatopoetically to denote by trying to utter <em>mb</em> the effect caused by shutting the lips on pronouncing a vowel), pronounced indistinctly (so that the words remain too much in the mouth) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [in later writers derived fr. <em>ambu</em>, water] sputtered, accompanied with saliva Pat. L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y. (<em>an-</em>, neg.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. a peculiar indistinct pronunciation of the vowels RPr&#x0101;t. Pat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; roaring (of beasts) accompanied with emission of saliva Uttarar. M&#x0101;lat&#x012b;m</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ara&#x1e47;i 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ar&#x00e1;&#x1e47;i</em> f. 'being fitted into' or 'turning round', the piece of wood (taken from the Ficus Religiosa or Premna Spinosa) used for kindling fire by attrition RV. &amp;c. (generally distinction is made between the lower one and the upper one, <em>adhar&#x00e2;ra&#x1e47;&#x00ed;</em> and <em>uttar&#x00e2;ra&#x1e47;i</em>, the former may also be meant by <em>ara&#x1e47;i</em> alone without <em>adhara</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (figuratively) a mother Hariv. (cf. <em>p&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;&#x00e1;v&#x00e2;ra&#x1e47;i</em> and <em>sur&#x00e2;ra&#x1e47;i</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>is</em>) m. the plant Premna Spinosa L., the sun L., (1), du. f. the two Ara&#x1e47;is (used for kindling the fire) RV. &amp;c</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bal&#x00e2;bala</em> n. rate of price, proper price, the cheapness or dearness of commodities Mn. ix, 329 (cf. <em>arghasya hr&#x0101;sa&#x1e43; v&#x1e5b;ddhi&#x1e43; va</em> Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. ii, 249). =</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; arghasa&#x1e43;sth&#x0101;pana </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>as</em>, rarely <em>am</em> [MBh. xiii, 7362]) m. n. the sea </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (hence) the number, 'four' S&#x016b;ryas </dd>

           <dt>arth </dt>
           <dd><em>arth</em> cl. 10. &#x0100;. <em>arthayate</em> (2. du. <em>arthay&#x0101;se</em> RV. x, 106, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. 2. sg. <em>arthay&#x0101;se</em> RV. i, 82, s) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely cl. 1. &#x0100;. (1. pl. <em>arth&#x0101;mahe</em> MBh. iii, 8613) to strive to obtain, desire, wish, request, ask for (acc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely Inf. [Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;. <em>yoddhum</em>]) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to point out the sense of. comment upon Comm. on M&#x1e5b;icch</dd>

           <dt>artha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x00e1;rtha</em> <em>as</em>, <em>am</em> m. n. [in RV. i-ix only n. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p90-3"></a>[Page 90, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in RV. x six times n. and thrice m </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in later Sansk&#x1e5b;it only m.] aim, purpose (very often <em>artham</em>, <em>arthena</em>, <em>arth&#x0101;ya</em>, and <em>arthe</em> ifc. or with gen., for the sake of. on account of. in behalf of. for') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cause, motive, reason Mn. ii, 213, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; advantage, use, utility (generally named with k&#x0101;ma and dharma, <em>tri-varga</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; used in wishing well to another, dat. or gen. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-3, 73) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thing, object (said of the membrum virile &#x015a;Br. xiv) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; object of the senses VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (hence) the number, five', Seiryas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; substance, wealth, property, opulence, money </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (hence in astron.) N. of the second mansion, the mansion of wealth (cf, <em>dhana</em>) VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; personified as the son of Dharma arid Buddhi BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; affair, concern (Ved. often acc. &#x00e1;rtham with &#x221a;<em>i</em>, or gam, to go to one's business, take up one's work RV. &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in law) lawsuit, action </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; having to do with (instr.), wanting, needing anything (instr.), SBr, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>sense</em>, meaning, notion (cf. <em>artha-&#x015b;abdau</em> and <em>arth&#x0101;t</em> s.v. below and <em>vedatattv&#x00e2;rtha-vid</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; manner, kind L., prohibition, prevention L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; price (for <em>argha</em>, q.v.) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;t</em>), abl. ind., s.v. below </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e</em>), loc. ind. with &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em> (g. <em>sak&#x1e63;&#x0101;d-&#x0101;di</em>, q.v.)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>&#x0101;rdidat</em>, or [after <em>ma</em>] ardayit P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 51) to make agitated, stir up, shake vehemently AV. iv, 15, 6 &amp; 11, vi, 49, 2, to do harm, torment, distress MBh. &amp;c.            <dt>&#x226b; ardha 2</dt>
           <dd><em>ardh&#x00e1;</em> mfn. (m. pl. <em>ardhe</em> or <em>ardhas</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-1, 33) half. halved, forming a half [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Osset">Osset.</a> <em>ardag</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ardh&#x00e1;</em>.. <em>ardh&#x00e1;</em> (or <em>n&#x00ed;ma</em>.. <em>ardh&#x00e1;</em> RV. x, 27' 18), one part, the other part </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e1;s</em>, <em>&#x00e1;m</em>), m. n. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) the half. RV. vi, 30, 1, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e1;m</em>), n. 'one part of two', with &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to give or leave to anybody (acc.) an equal share of (gen.) RV. ii, 30, 5 and vi, 44, 18 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a part, party RV. iv, 32, 1 and vii, 18, 16 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e</em>), loc. ind. in the middle, S&#x0101;k. (<em>ardha</em>) in comp. with a subst. means 'the half part of anything' [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 2-2, 2], with an adj. or past Pass. p.            <dd>&#x2022; also with an adj. indicating measure [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> vii, 3, 26 and 27] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a peculiar kind of compound is formed with ordinals [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-1, 23 Comm.], e.g. <em>ardha-t&#x1e5b;t&#x012b;ya</em>, containing a half for its third, i.e. two and a half </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ardha-caturtha</em>, having a half for its fourth, three and a half.)</dd>

           <dd><em>av</em> cl.            <dd>&#x2022; perf. 3&#x1e63;g. <em>&#x0101;va</em>, 2. pl. <em>&#x0101;v&#x00e1;</em> RV. viii, 7, 18, 2&#x1e63;g. <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;vitha</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>&#x00e1;vit</em>, 2. sg. <em>&#x0101;viis</em>, <em>aviis</em> and <em>avi&#x1e63;as</em>, Imper. <em>avi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;u</em>, 2. sg. <em>avi&#x1e0d;&#x1e0d;h&#x00ed;</em> [once RV. ii, 17, 8] or <em>avi&#x1e0d;&#x1e0d;h</em> <em>six times in &#x1e5b;V.</em>, 2. du. <em>avi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;am</em>, 3. du., 2. pl. <em>avi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00e1;n&#x0101;</em> RV. vii, 18, 25, Prec. 3. sg. <em>avy&#x0101;s</em>, Inf. <em>&#x00e1;vitave</em> RV. vii, 33, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ved. ind. p. <em>&#x0101;vy&#x0101;</em> RV. i, 166, 13) to drive, impel, animate (as a car or horse) RV </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; avaccheda </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; descended, dismounted, alighted</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; avarodha 2</dt>
           <dd><em>ava-rodha</em> m. (&#x221a;1. <em>rudh</em> = <em>&#x221a;ruh</em>) 'moving down',      <ol>         <li>           <em>rodha</em>         </li>       </ol>       <p> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (= <em>ava-roha</em> below) a shoot or &#x221a;sent down by a branch (of the Indian fig-tree) AitBr</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; avarodhana 2</dt>
           <dd><em>ava-rodhana</em> n. descending motion (opposed to <em>ud rodhana</em>, q.v.) AitBr</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; avaropa&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>ava-ropa&#x1e47;a</em> n. planting MBh. xiii, 2991, causing to descend L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; lowered, lessened Mn. i, 82, curtailed, lost (as dominions, <em>r&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;r&#x0101;&#x1e47;i</em>) BhP., silenced (in dispute) BhP</dd>

           <dt>avas&#x1e5b;p </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; a&#x015b;vamedha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;medh&#x00e1;</em> m. the horse-sacrifice (a celebrated ceremony, the antiquity of which reaches back to the Vedic period ; the hymns RV. i, 162 and 163 [= VS. xxii seqq.], referring to it, are however of comparatively late origin ; in later times its efficacy was so exaggerated, that a hundred such sacrifices entitled the sacrificer to displace Indra from the dominion of Svarga ; kings who engaged in it spent enormous sums in gifts to the Br&#x0101;hmans ; it is said that the horse was sometimes not immolated, but kept bound during the ceremony) VS. xviii, 22 TS. Ragh. &amp;c., (cf. <em>ark&#x00e2;&#x015b;vamedh&#x00e1;</em>) ; (<em>a&#x015b;vamedha</em>) <em>-k&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a</em> n. N. of &#x015a;Br.xiii (treating of the A&#x015b;vamedha) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (for <em>a&#x015b;vi-sutau</em>) the two sons of the A&#x015b;vins, viz. Nakula and Sahadeva MBh. v, 1816 </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>a&#x015b;vin&#x012b;-putrau</em> below) RV. v, 46, 8 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the head of Aries or the first of the 28 Nakshatras Jyot. VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>a&#x015b;vini</em>, shortened for the sake of metre) S&#x016b;ryas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>i</em>), n. (= <em>a&#x015b;va-vat</em> n. q.v.) richness in horses RV. i, 53, 4</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (in comp.) the eight parts (as of an army [MBh. ii, 197] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or of a court, viz. the law, the judge, assessors, scribe, and astrologer, gold, fire, and water L.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00e2;&#x1e45;ga</em>)<em>-naya</em> or <em>-p&#x0101;ta</em> [see <em>s&#x00e2;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00e2;&#x1e45;ga-p&#x0101;tam</em>] or <em>-pra&#x1e47;&#x0101;ma</em> m. prostration of the eight parts of the body (in performing very profound obeisance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the eight parts are the hands, breast, forehead, eyes, throat, and middle of the back </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or the first four, with the knees and feet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or these six, with the speech and mind) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-h&#x1e5b;daya</em> n. N. of a medical work of V&#x0101;gbha&#x1e6d;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00e2;&#x1e45;g&#x00e2;rghya</em> n. an offering of eight articles (water, milk, Ku&#x015b;a grass, curds, ghee, rice, barley, and mustard </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or honey, red oleander flowers, and sandal are substituted for the last three)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x0101;dhy&#x0101;y&#x012b; </dt>

           <dd><em>as</em> cl.2. P. <em>&#x00e1;sti</em> (2. sg. <em>&#x00e1;si</em>, 1. sg. <em>&#x00e1;smi</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. <em>sm&#x00e1;si</em> or <em>sm&#x00e1;s</em>, <em>sth&#x00e1;</em>, <em>s&#x00e1;nti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (rarely &#x0100;., e.g. 1.pl. <em>smahe</em> MBh. xiii, 13) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. <em>&#x00e1;sat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Imper. <em>astu</em>, 2. sg. <em>edhi</em> (fr. <em>as-dhi</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 6-4, 119) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>sy&#x0101;&#x0341;t</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; impf. <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;s&#x012b;t</em>, rarely <em>&#x0101;s</em> [only in RV. x </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 7-3, 97] <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p117-2"></a>[Page 117, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; perf. 1. and 3&#x1e63;g, <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;sa</em>, 2. sg. <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;sitha</em>, 3. pl. <em>&#x0101;s&#x00fa;&#x1e25;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. m. <em>s&#x00e1;t</em> f. <em>sat&#x012b;&#x0341;</em>) to be, live, exist, be present </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to take place, happen </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to abide, dwell, stay </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to belong to (gen. or dat.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fall to the share of. happen to any one (gen.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be equal to (dat.) &#x015a;Br. xiv Mn. xi, 85 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to turn out, tend towards any result, prove (with dat.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to become B&#x1e5b;&#x0100;rUp. &amp;c., (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-4, 51-55) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be (i.e. used as copula, but not only with adj., but also with adv. [e.g. <em>t&#x016b;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x012b;m &#x0101;s&#x012b;t</em> MBh. iii, 4041], and often with part., [e.g. perf. Pass. p. <em>prasthit&#x0101;&#x1e25; sma</em>, N </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. p.p. <em>hantavyo'smi</em>, N </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. p. especially with Pot., and only in &#x015a;Br., as <em>y&#x00e1;di d&#x0101;sy&#x00e1;n-t-sy&#x0101;&#x0341;t</em>, 'if he should intend to give'] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the pf. <em>&#x0101;sa</em> helps to form the periphrastic perf., and <em>asmi</em> &amp;c. the fut.) ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> ? Lat' <em>es-t</em> ; Goth. [117, 2] <em>is-t</em> ; Lith. <em>es-ti</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>ah 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ah</em> (defect. verb, only perf. 3. sg. <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;ha</em> and 3. pl. <em>&#x0101;h&#x00fa;h</em> RV. AV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. sg. <em>&#x0101;ttha</em> &#x015a;Br. xiv (B&#x1e5b;&#x0100;rUp.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. Ragh. iii, 48 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. du. <em>&#x0101;hatu&#x1e25;</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-2, 35) to say, speak RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with lexicographers) to express, signify </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to call (by name, <em>n&#x0101;mn&#x0101;</em>) MBh. iii, 16065 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to call, hold, consider, regard as (with two acc., for one of which may be substituted a phrase with <em>iti</em>) RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to state or declare with reference to (acc.) B&#x1e5b;&#x0100;rUp. &#x015a;ak. Megh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to acknowledge, accept, state AitBr. Mn. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to adjudge anything (acc.) to any one (gen.), Mn ix, 44. [Cf. Hib. <em>ag-all</em>, 'speech' ; <em>eigh-im</em>, 'I call' ; Goth. <em>af-aika</em>, 'I deny' ; Lat. <em>nego</em> for <em>n'-ego</em>, 'to say no' ; <em>ad-ag-ium</em>, <em>ajo</em>, &amp;c.]</dd>

           <dt>aho 2</dt>
           <dd><em>aho</em> ind. a particle (implying joyful or painful surprise) Ah! (of enjoyment or satisfaction) Oh! (of fatigue, discontent, compassion, sorrow, regret) Alas! Ah! (of praise, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 8-1, 40 seq.) Bravo! (of reproach) Fie! (of calling Kum. iii, 20) Ho! Halo! (of contempt) Pshaw! Often combined with other particles of similar signification, as <em>aho dhik</em> or <em>dhig aho</em>, <em>aho bata</em>, &amp;c</dd>
